project_description: A simple Flutter app that shows text 'Eagle' and changes to 'Dog' when clicked, using the Cubit pattern for state management.
architecture_overview: The project follows a layered architecture with separate folders for models, cubits, screens, and widgets. State management is handled using the Cubit pattern.

files.name: lib/main.dart
files.description: Entry point of the Flutter application. Initializes the Cubit and sets up the home screen.

methods.name: main
methods.description: Entry point method for the application.

methods.name: build
methods.description: Builds the widget tree for the application.

files.name: lib/cubits/text_cubit.dart
files.description: Cubit file for managing the state of the text (Eagle/Dog).

files.name: lib/models/text_model.dart
files.description: Model representing the state of the text.

methods.name: toJson
methods.description: Converts the TextState instance to a JSON map.

methods.name: TextState.fromJson
methods.description: Creates a TextState instance from a JSON map.

files.name: lib/screens/home_screen.dart
files.description: Home screen of the application displaying the text and a button to toggle it.

methods.name: build
methods.description: Builds the widget tree for the HomeScreen.

methods.name: build
methods.description: Builds the widget tree for the TextDisplay widget.

widgets.name: TextDisplay
widgets.description: Displays the current text (Eagle/Dog) and a button to toggle the text.

cubits.name: TextCubit
cubits.description: Manages the state of the text, toggling between 'Eagle' and 'Dog'.

models.name: TextState
models.description: Represents the state of the text.

dependencies.name: flutter
dependencies.purpose: Flutter framework for building the UI.

dependencies.name: flutter_bloc
dependencies.purpose: Cubit pattern implementation for state management.

sequence_diagram:
@startuml
actor User
User -> HomeScreen: Click Toggle Button
HomeScreen -> TextCubit: toggleText()
TextCubit -> TextState: Update State
TextState -> HomeScreen: New State
HomeScreen -> TextDisplay: Update Text
@enduml
state_management_flow: State is managed using the Cubit pattern. The TextCubit toggles the text state between 'Eagle' and 'Dog'. The HomeScreen listens to the state changes and updates the TextDisplay widget accordingly.
navigation_flow: The app has a single screen (HomeScreen) which displays the text and a button to toggle the text.

pubspec_yaml.name: cat_dog_app
pubspec_yaml.description: A simple Flutter app that shows text 'Eagle' and changes to 'Dog' when clicked.
